Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian Type B1 pottery kantharos with trace of handle root at rim; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; spiked rosette in added white outline with added red centres above two white and red bands; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two concentric white bands (Williams 1983, 169) and many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim; several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1864) (phase 2)
